chunk_analysis.page_text:
Mail: Robert D Phillips, 745 6th St., New Martinsville, WV
11-16-84

373
31-87-39

THIS DEED, made this 27th day of August, 1984, by and between LAWRENCE PROBST and OTA PROBST, his wife, KENNETH ICE and RUTH ANN ICE, his wife, BILLY GENE PROBST and PEARL PROBST, his wife, CLARE PROBST and REGINA PROBST, his wife, and JEANNETTE PROBST, single, parties of the first part, and ROBERT D. PHILLIPS and MARY JANE NORTHCRAFT, parties of the second part.

WITNESSETH, that for and in consideration of the sum of Five ($5.00) Dollars and other good and valuable considerations, the receipt of all of which is hereby acknowledged, the said parties of the first part do hereby grant and convey unto the said parties of the second part, the following described property, to-wit:

A tract of land located on the West side and adjacent to W.V. Rt. 180, approximately two miles South of the intersection of W.V. Rt. 2 & 180, near the mouth of Whiskey Run and Point Pleasant Creek, Magnolia District, Wetzel County, West Virginia, more precisely described as follows:

Beginning at a point in the center line of W.V. Rt. 180, referenced by the intersection of W.V. Rt. 180 center line and W.V. Rt. 2/1 (Whiskey Run Road) center line S70-56W, 73.1' and S79-21W, 56.91'. Thence through the W.V. Rt. 180 R/W and with the Hisson line up the hill

N12-48W, 1594.12' to a 1/2" x 1" iron rod (set) common corner to Hisson's 36.7 acre and 12.78 acre tract, referenced by a 6"Ø Sassafras S5E, 2' (3 mks.), 13"Ø Sugar Maple S45W, 13.5' (3 mks.), and a 5"Ø Sugar Maple N40W, 10' (3 mks.). Thence continuing with the Hisson line up and over the hill

N52-42E, 514.00' to a 1" iron rod (set), common corner to the Hisson 36.7 acre tract, Probst Heirs 149.98 acre tract and referenced by a 14"Ø Elm N10E, 14' (3 mks.) and 7"Ø Elm S25W, 16.5' (3 mks.). Thence continuing around the hill with the Probst Heirs line

N52-42E, 481.27' to a point in the Probst Heirs line and common corner to Berisford's 27.11 acre tract. Thence down the hill with the Berisford line and fence

S39-50E, 146.81' to a 14"Ø Gum with barbed wire fence. Thence continuing with the Berisford line down the hill and the fence line

S39-50E, 208.83' to a fence post. Thence continuing down the hill with the Berisford line and fence

S39-39E, 290.09' to a 4"Ø Beech with barbed wire at the foot of the hill by the run. Thence continuing down the run with the Berisford line and fence

S37-11E, 274.21' to a fence post. Thence continuing down the run with the Berisford line and fence

S49-00E, 202.91' to a fence post. Thence continuing with the Berisford line and fence

S44-54E, 190.33' to the center line of Old Alternate Rt. 18. Thence with the center line of Alt. 18 down the road, a series of 6 calls

S31-51W, 71.03'
S40-28W, 113.21'
S28-59W, 365.18'
S23-03W, 77.27'
S3-58E, 153.94'
S36-14E, 47.11' to the center line of W.V. Rt. 180. Thence with the center line of Rt. 180

S54-41W, 306.72' to a point in the center line of the road. Thence

S70-56W, 822.17' to the point of beginning, containing 49.50 acres more or less (incl. 3.32 acres of Rt. 180 and Alt. 18 R/W, and 0.33 acres as described in Phillips deeds 208/303 and 208/305) as surveyed by C.A. Smith, Spring of 1984 and shown on Plat #516, sheet 2 of 2 attached here-with and made a part of this deed description.

Being a portion of the land conveyed unto Victor Probst by deed recorded in the Office of the Clerk of the County Commission of Wetzel County, West Virginia in Deed Book 140, page 476. Victor E. Probst died intestate February 5, 1951, leaving surviving him as his sole and only heirs at law, Lawrence Probst, a son, Sophie Phillips, a daughter, Rosena Ice, a daughter, Jeannette Probst, a daughter, and Billy Gene Probst and Clare Probst, sons of William P. Probst, a son of Victor E. Probst. Sophie Phillips died intestate February 12, 1975, leaving surviving her as her sole and only heirs at law, Burney Phillips, widower, now deceased, and Robert Phillips and Mary Jane Northcraft, children. Rosena Ice died intestate December 11, 1983, leaving surviving her as her sole and only heirs at law, Kenneth Ice, a son.

The said Jeannette Probst, single, reserves unto herself all of her interest in the oil and gas within and underlying the above described property.

This conveyance is made subject to all reservations, exceptions, grants of rights of way and easements made by the parties and prior owners.

WITNESS the following signatures and seals:

LAWRENCE PROBST (SEAL)
OTA PROBST (SEAL)
KENNETH ICE (SEAL)
RUTH ANN ICE (SEAL)
BILLY GENE PROBST (SEAL)
PEARL PROBST (SEAL)

detailed_samples.reasoning: This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation, specifically:
This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation as evidenced by this specific language:
This document contains an actual, explicit mineral rights reservation as evidenced by this specific language:

Being a portion of the land conveyed unto Victor Probst by deed recorded in the Office of the Clerk of the County Commission of Wetzel County, West Virginia in Deed Book 140, page 476. Victor E. Sophie Phillips died intestate February 12, 1975, leaving surviving her as her sole and only heirs at law, Burney Phillips, widower, now deceased, and Robert Phillips and Mary Jane Northcraft, children.
